## 1. Products Table

Description: Stores your catalog of items – product ID, name, category, price, and availability.

::: {style="font-size: 0.8em;"}
| product_id | name | price | in_stock |
|------------|------|-------|----------|
| 1 | Wireless Headphones | 79.99 | 1 |
| 2 | Coffee Beans | 14.99 | 1 |
| 3 | T-Shirt | 24.99 | 1 |
| 4 | USB-C Cable | 12.99 | 0 |
:::

## 2. Orders Table

Description: Records transactions – which customer bought what product, quantity ordered, and completion status. The product_id links to the Products table.

::: {style="font-size: 0.8em;"}
| order_id | product_id | customer | qty | completed |
|----------|------------|----------|-----|-----------|
| 101 | 1 | Alice | 2 | 1 |
| 102 | 2 | Bob | 5 | 1 |
| 103 | 3 | Carol | 3 | 0 |
| 104 | 1 | David | 1 | 1 |
| 105 | 3 | Alice | 1 | 1 |
:::
